sep.gaia.resources

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.Query
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocationQuery, POIQuery, TileQuery

    public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes a query to be performed by a loader (s. AbstractLoader). This bean-class stores dummy-resources to be filled by the respective loading entity. If additional information is required for the query to be performed, it can be provided by subclassing this type.
    Author:
    Matthias Fisch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Query(java.util.Collection<DataResource> resources)
      Initializes by a collection of dummy-resources to be filled with the information gathered by the query.
      Query(java.util.Map<DataResource,java.lang.Integer> resources)
      Initializes by a collection of dummy-resources to be filled with the information gathered by the query.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Query

        public Query(java.util.Collection<DataResource> resources)
      throws NotADummyException
        Initializes by a collection of dummy-resources to be filled with the information gathered by the query.
        Parameters:
        resources - The collection of dummy-resources to be filled with the information gathered by the query. Default-priority is assumed for all entries in the collection.
        Throws:
        NotADummyException - Thrown if any resource in resources.keySet() does not have the dummy-flag set.

      • Query

        public Query(java.util.Map<DataResource,java.lang.Integer> resources)
      throws NotADummyException
        Initializes by a collection of dummy-resources to be filled with the information gathered by the query.
        Parameters:
        resources - The collection of dummy-resources to be filled with the information gathered by the query mapped to their respective priority.
        Throws:
        NotADummyException - Thrown if any resource in resources.keySet() does not have the dummy-flag set.

    • Method Detail

      • getResourcesByPriority

        public java.util.Collection<DataResource> getResourcesByPriority()
        Returns the dummy-resources contained in the query sorted by priority. The first resources are those with highest priority.
        Returns:
        The dummy-resources contained in the query.

      • getResources

        public java.util.Collection<DataResource> getResources()
        Returns the dummy-resources contained in the query.
        Returns:
        The dummy-resources contained in the query.

      • addResource

        public void addResource(DataResource resource,
               int priority)
                 throws NotADummyException
        Adds resource with a priority of zero. The passed object must be a dummy-resource (see DataResource.isDummy()).
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to be added.
        priority - The priority of the resource to add.
        Throws:
        NotADummyException - Thrown if resource does not have the dummy-flag set.
